titleStmt.title: The Roman wonder being truth confest by papists : wherein the clergy of the Church of England in their charge of heretical and damnable doctrines upon the Jesuits are fully and fairly justified : first, by the suffrage and consent of the Romish Arch-bishops, Bishops, and eminent doctors and divines of France secondly, by the verdict of the Lords Cardianls Inquisitors at Rome, thirdly, by the decretal sentence of this present Pope Innocent the XI. made the second of March last was a twelvemonth, 1679 / written originally in Latine and French, and now translated into English for the satisfactory information of all papists in England, and the unanswerable vindication of the Church of England.

notesStmt.note: Caption title: The Jesuits morals condemned.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
